base64.description: Set to `true` if the data is `base64` encoded. For example image data from a `<canvas>` element. Plain text and HTML do not need this option.

binary.description:
Set to `true` if the data should be treated as raw content, `false` if this is a text. If `base64` is used,
this defaults to `true`, if the data is not a `string`, this will be set to `true`.

date.description: Enables basic storage and retrieval of dates and times.

optimizedBinaryString.description: Set to `true` if (and only if) the input is a "binary string" and has already been prepared with a `0xFF` mask.

createFolders.description: Set to `true` if folders in the file path should be automatically created, otherwise there will only be virtual folders that represent the path to the file.

dir.description: Set to `true` if this is a directory and content should be ignored.

dosPermissions.description: 6 bits number. The DOS permissions of the file, if any.

unixPermissions.description:
16 bits number. The UNIX permissions of the file, if any.
Also accepts a `string` representing the octal value: `"644"`, `"755"`, etc.
